lines.text: At the end, I had my father in a nursing home. I gave him the best doctors in Illinois. He was a little senile... not much. I never spent much time with him. I was too busy. Finally, when I got around to seeing him, he didn't recognize me. Till the day he died, he didn't know who the hell I was.
Here I thought you were the perfect son, Charlie.
No. They told me there was only one of those guys. Listen, you take care of what you've got to take care of. I'll take care of Woolridge.
[last lines]

[to David]
You're the last person I ever thought would come through for me.
The only advice my Mom ever gave me was, "Don't live in the same city as your parents."
What crappy advice. I can't get my parents to move.
Your best friend is your dick.
Now where did I learn that? Your best friend is *your* dick.
Great, maybe the four of us can get together and have lunch.
My daughter speaks very highly of you. Says you're a great lay.

[David's gun accidentally goes off]
She told you that?
My baby girl tells me everything.
That's some conversation for a father to be having with his daughter.
I raised her to be a corporate executive. I raised her to be a man.
So did my father, but I never tell him anything.
That was something we all had in common... your grandfather, me, you. We always knew had to talk a girl into bed.
I'm glad you still can.
I can't. I can't do it anymore.
I could've been a great doctor.
You could've been a great anything, son.

[to Andrew Woolridge]
Sir, I was just wondering. By eating your entire meal with the salad fork, does that include the soup?
I lost my lines. They fired me.

[David gets out of his Jeep and walks around angrily for a few moments, then gets back in the car]
What are you gonna do?
I know you hate me. But you have to help me.
I'm just protecting my balls, just as, I'm sure, at one time or another, you have protected your own
Mom, why don't you put on your shoes and come out of the cage? How many guys have said that to their mothers?
Oh, don't kiss me - I don't know where your lips have been.
